edu.mines.jtk.interp

Class SimpleGridder3

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mines.jtk.interp.SimpleGridder3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Gridder3

    public class SimpleGridder3
extends java.lang.Object
implements Gridder3
    Simple griding of scattered samples of 3D functions f(x1,x2,x3). Each gridded value is simply the average of the values of all known samples that lie within the corresponding grid cell. For a grid cell that contains no such known samples, the gridded value is null.

    Note that this simple method performs no interpolation for grid cells that do not contain at least one scattered sample. It may however be used as a first step in other more sophisticated gridding methods. In particular, the averaging performed by this simple gridder provides a crude form of anti-alias filtering when grid cells contain multiple scattered samples.

    Version:
    2009.07.22
    Author:
    Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

      • grid

        public float[][][] grid(Sampling s1,
               Sampling s2,
               Sampling s3)
        Description copied from interface: Gridder3
        Computes gridded sample values from the known sample values. Known (scattered) samples must be set before calling this method. Some implementations require that the specified samplings be uniform.
